original_title: Uptick in stock market’s fortunes following US import tariff reduction
original_body_lines: The CSE was trading up yesterday following US President Donald Trump’s announcement of a reduced tariff rate of 20 percent on goods exports, market analysts said.
Initially, Sri Lanka was slapped with a 44 percent tariff, which was then reduced to 30 percent. The reduced tariff came into effect yesterday.
Sri Lanka’s rate is the same or similar to that of Bangladesh, Vietnam, Malaysia (19), Indonesia (19), Thailand (19), Pakistan (19) and lower to that of India (25).
Amid those developments both indices moved upwards. The ASPI stood at 217.7 points, while the S&P SL20 was up by 135 points.

In the retail market top seven companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; Dipped Products Rs 532 million (8.7 million shares traded), Pan Asia Bank Rs 376 million (6.7 million shares traded), JKH Rs 318 million (13 million shares traded), Commercial Bank Rs 281 million (1.6 million shares traded), DFCC Rs 273 million (1.8 million shares traded), Commercial Credit Rs 248 mi(2.1 million shares traded) and HNB (Non- Voting) Rs 220 million (748,000 shares traded). During the day 417 million share volumes changed hands in 43880 transactions.

Stocks that saw active volumes traded included several export companies; Hela Apparel was up 30 cents at Rs 3.80, Dipped Products was up Rs 3.10 at Rs 64.10, and Hayleys Fabric was up Rs 2.80 at Rs 48.20.
Hayleys Fibre, which exports coconut fiber and coir-based products, was trading up Rs 2.20 at Rs 53.50.
However, Royal Ceramics, which also exports floor and wall tiles, bathware and sanitaryware to the USA, was trading down 10 cents at Rs 42.80.

Yesterday, rupee opened stronger at Rs 301.85/95 to the US dollar in the spot market from Rs 302.10/20 the previous day, while the bond yields were down after a reduction of the Trump tariff to 20 percent from 30, dealers said.

Market activity was up. A bond maturing on 15.12.2026 was quoted at 8.00/10 percent, down from 8.10/20 percent. A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 8.35/45 percent, down from 8.45/55 percent. A bond maturing on 15.10.2028 was quoted at 8.75/85 percent, down from 8.97/9.02 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was quoted at 9.37/43 percent, down from 9.50/54 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2030 was quoted at 9.55/65 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.03.2031 was quoted at 9.85/95 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted at 10.22/27 percent, down from 10.38/42 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.06.2033 was quoted at 10.60/68 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2034 was quoted at 10.75/80 percent.
